title: Free agent Antonio Brown shares video on Instagram training on football field
text:
Embattled wide receiver Antonio Brown is proving that he's ready to get back in the game after he was booted from the New England Patriots amid accusations of sexual assault.

Despite his fall from NFL grace, the 31-year-old free agent has taken to Instagram to prove he's not ready to give up his football career and is training to get back onto the field.

Brown shared a video on his Instagram story hitting the turf and running on a football field in the Fort Lauderdale area.

His workout comes just days after the NFL Player's Association filed a grievance on his behalf seeking a stunning $40million from the Patriots and Oakland Raiders teams in unpaid salary, fines and unpaid guarantees.

Embattled wide receiver Antonio Brown is proving that he's ready to get back in the game by sharing an Instagram video of himself training, despite not being signed to an NFL team

Brown shared a video on his Instagram story hitting the turf and running on a football field in the Fort Lauderdale are on Monday

His workout comes just days after the NFL Player's Association filed a grievance on his behalf seeking a stunning $40million from the Patriots and Oakland Raiders teams in unpaid salary, fines and unpaid guarantees

It's been a rocky year for the wide receiver as he saw himself cut by the Raiders in September following a dispute with General Manager Mike Mayock over a series of fines.

He then signed a $15million deal with the New England Patriots on September 7 but was let go after just one game with the team on September 20.

He was let go after two women accused him of sexual misconduct, three days before the Patriots were due to pay him the first $5 million installment of the signing bonus.

In the grievance Brown is attempting to get $31million from the Raiders. He's also attempting to get his unpaid Week 1 salary of $64,062, plus an unpaid $9 million signing bonus, from New England, according to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport.

The grievances aren't likely to be heard by the system arbitrator until spring.

Brown's former trainer Britney Taylor filed a lawsuit in federal court, accusing him of sexually assaulting her twice in 2017 and forcibly raping her in 2018.

Drew Rosenhaus (left), Brown's agent, believes his client will be back in the NFL if and when the league clears him of any wrongdoing. Rosenhaus claims a few teams have expressed interest

Antonio Brown has been accused in a lawsuit of raping his former trainer, Britney Taylor (left)

A Sports Illustrated report then spoke to another woman who claims she was hired in 2017 to paint a mural in his Pennsylvania home, where he disrobed and approached her while wearing only a had towel over his genitals.

That unidentified woman has not sued, nor is she pressing charges.

Brown's former trainer Britney Taylor filed a lawsuit in federal court, accusing him of sexually assaulting her twice in 2017 and forcibly raping her in 2018

However, that did not stop Brown from sending her menacing text messages in the days that followed.

Brown has denied all charges of sexual misconduct.

After he was cut he took to Twitter in a frenzy to slam the NFL for their double standard pointing out how his very own former boss Patriots owner Robert Kraft was hit with prostitution soliciting charges in Florida, but was able to keep his job.

Meanwhile Brown's Agent Drew Rosenhaus played coy in September and said Brown wanted to return to the NFL with a different team and was reportedly talking to interested teams.

However, he noted that they wanted information regarding Brown's 'legal situation' and Brown isn't likely to be signed until an NFL investigation into his conduct is completed.
description: Embattled wide receiver Antonio Brown, 31,  is proving that he's ready to get back in the game by sharing an Instagram video of himself training, despite not being signed to an NFL team.
